newsitem.title: UK: Hopes rise of Bass /Allied deal today.
newsitem.headline: Hopes rise of Bass /Allied deal today.

text.p: Sources close to British brewer and leisure group Bass Plc and Allied said the two are close to announcing an agreed deal over Allied's half share in brewer Carlsberg-Tetley, possibly as soon as today.
"I'd say there is an 80 percent chance of it coming later on today," said one source close to the deal.
Both companies confirmed they were in talks on July 29 and many analysts and newspapers then expected an announcement of the agreed terms in a matter of days.
Bass is widely expected to pay some 200 million stg for Allied's stake while Danish brewer Carlsberg A/S is seen taking 20 percent of Bass's enlarged British brewing business.
The deal is also believed by analysts and investors to include a fall-back clause whereby, if the sale is blocked by Britain's competition authorities, Carlsberg will raise its stake in C-T.
